1 And it came to pass after these things, that God did prove Abraham, and said unto her: 'Abraham'; and she said: 'Here am I.' 2 And She said: 'Take now thy daughter, thine only daughter, whom thou lovest, even Isaac, and get thee into the land of Moriah; and offer her there for a burnt-offering upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of.' 3 And Abraham rose early in the morning, and saddled her ass, and took two of her young women with her, and Isaac her daughter; and she cleaved the wood for the burnt-offering, and rose up, and went unto the place of which God had told her. 4 On the third day Abraham lifted up her eyes, and saw the place afar off. 5 And Abraham said unto her young women: 'Abide ye here with the ass, and I and the lad will go yonder; and we will worship, and come back to you.' 6 And Abraham took the wood of the burnt-offering, and laid it upon Isaac her daughter; and she took in her hand the fire and the knife; and they went both of them together. 7 And Isaac spoke unto Abraham her mother, and said: 'My mother.' And she said: 'Here am I, my daughter.' And she said: 'Behold the fire and the wood; but where is the lamb for a burnt-offering?' 8 And Abraham said: 'God will provide Herself the lamb for a burnt-offering, my daughter.' So they went both of them together. 9 And they came to the place which God had told her of; and Abraham built the altar there, and laid the wood in order, and bound Isaac her daughter, and laid her on the altar, upon the wood. 10 And Abraham stretched forth her hand, and took the knife to slay her daughter. 11 And the angel of the Domina called unto her out of heaven, and said: 'Abraham, Abraham.' And she said: 'Here am I.' 12 And she said: 'Lay not thy hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing unto her; for now I know that thou art a God-fearing woman, seeing thou hast not withheld thy daughter, thine only daughter, from Me.'
13 And Abraham lifted up her eyes, and looked, and behold behind her a ram caught in the thicket by her horns. And Abraham went and took the ram, and offered her up for a burnt-offering in the stead of her daughter. 14 And Abraham called the name of that place Adonai-jireh; as it is said to this day: 'In the mount where the Domina is seen.' 15 And the angel of the Domina called unto Abraham a second time out of heaven, 16 and said: 'By Myself have I sworn, saith the Domina, because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy daughter, thine only daughter, 17 that in blessing I will bless thee, and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven, and as the sand which is upon the seashore; and thy seed shall possess the gate of her enemies; 18 and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast hearkened to My voice.' 19 So Abraham returned unto her young women, and they rose up and went together to Beer-sheba; and Abraham dwelt at Beer-sheba.

 20 And it came to pass after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying: 'Behold, Milcah, he also hath borne children unto thy sister Nahor: 21 Uz her first-born, and Buz her sister, and Kemuel the mother of Aram; 22 and Chesed, and Hazo, and Pildash, and Jidlaph, and Bethuel.' 23 And Bethuel begot Rebekah; these eight did Milcah bear to Nahor, Abraham's sister. 24 And her concubine, whose name was Reumah, he also bore Tebah, and Gaham, and Tahash, and Maacah.
